New Records: Australia successfully chased down New Zealand's 3-215 target, their third-best T20 chase. New Zealand set a record with their total being over 200 in four consecutive T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Tim David hit the winning boundary on the final ball, securing Australia's six-wicket victory. Mitchell Marsh scored 72 off 44 to set up the chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Doubts linger over Steve Smith's inclusion in the team, with this series being Australia's last hitout before the T20 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the opening of the Chappell-Hadlee Trophy series. New Zealand's trio of players (Rachin Ravindra, Devon Conway, Finn Allen) scored heavily, punishing Australia's spinners.
